references: The OOD property of cross-modal vector search can be mathematically quantified using two mathematical distances: the Wasserstein distance (Vaserstein, 1969; Kantorovich, 1960) that measures two distributions and the Mahalanobis distance (Vaserstein, 1969; Kantorovich, 1960) that measures two distributions and the Mahalanobis distance (Mahalanobis, 2018) that measures the distance from a vector to a distribution. We use two metrics to evaluate data distributions on three modern real-world multimodal datasets: Text-to-Image (Mahalanobis, 2018) that measures the distance from a vector to a distribution. We use two metrics to evaluate data distributions on three modern real-world multimodal datasets: Text-to-Image (Dmitry Baranchuk, 2021), LAION (Dmitry Baranchuk, 2021), LAION (Schuhmann et al., 2021), and WebVid (Schuhmann et al., 2021), and WebVid (Bain et al., 2021). The characteristics of these datasets are shown in (Bain et al., 2021). The characteristics of these datasets are shown in Table 1.

Evaluations of IVF and HNSW are conducted on three multimodal datasets shown in Table 1. In-distribution (ID) queries are sourced from original large-scale datasets that follow the same empirical distribution of base data, and OOD queries use the textual query set for each dataset. We build IVF indexes by the Faiss library (Johnson et al., 2019) and HNSW indexes by the official implementations (Johnson et al., 2019) and HNSW indexes by the official implementations (Malkov and Yashunin, 2020) with recommended parameters. (Malkov and Yashunin, 2020) with recommended parameters.

Datasets. Three modern large-scale cross-modal datasets shown in Table 1 are used for evaluation. Text-to-Image (Dmitry Baranchuk, 2021) is a popular benchmark with query distribution that differs from the base data, consisting of image and textual query vectors produced by the Se-ResNext-101 model (Dmitry Baranchuk, 2021) is a popular benchmark with query distribution that differs from the base data, consisting of image and textual query vectors produced by the Se-ResNext-101 model (Hu et al., 2018) a variant of the DSSM model (Hu et al., 2018) a variant of the DSSM model (Huang et al., 2013). The evaluation of similarity relies on the inner product, termed MIPS (maximum inner product search), with a larger value indicating a closer relationship. LAION (Huang et al., 2013). The evaluation of similarity relies on the inner product, termed MIPS (maximum inner product search), with a larger value indicating a closer relationship. LAION (Radford et al., 2021a) contains millions of Image-Alt-Text pairs used as vector search benchmarks in (Radford et al., 2021a) contains millions of Image-Alt-Text pairs used as vector search benchmarks in (Tellez et al., 2023), the embeddings of image and text are produced by an advanced model, CLIP-ViT-B/32 (Tellez et al., 2023), the embeddings of image and text are produced by an advanced model, CLIP-ViT-B/32 (Radford et al., 2021b). The distance measurement between texts and images is based on cosine distance. WebVid (Radford et al., 2021b). The distance measurement between texts and images is based on cosine distance. WebVid (Bain et al., 2021) comprises caption and video pairs that are sourced from stock footage sites, with similarity determined by cosine distance. For WebVid, embeddings used in this paper are frame embeddings provided by (Bain et al., 2021) comprises caption and video pairs that are sourced from stock footage sites, with similarity determined by cosine distance. For WebVid, embeddings used in this paper are frame embeddings provided by (Kilian, 2022), which are also encoded by CLIP-ViT-B/32. The official 10K vectors from (Kilian, 2022), which are also encoded by CLIP-ViT-B/32. The official 10K vectors from (Dmitry Baranchuk, 2021) are used for querying on Text-to-Image, and two sets of 10K textual vectors sampled from original datasets are used for evaluating LAION and WebVid. In addition, a substantial amount of textual vectors, non-intersecting with queries for evaluation, are provided for index construction within the respective datasets. (Dmitry Baranchuk, 2021) are used for querying on Text-to-Image, and two sets of 10K textual vectors sampled from original datasets are used for evaluating LAION and WebVid. In addition, a substantial amount of textual vectors, non-intersecting with queries for evaluation, are provided for index construction within the respective datasets.
